H0.text: Return to their summer feeding area is what reindeer would do when increased snowfall during the entire winter in southern areas forces them to rely on less nutritious food such as lichen.

H1.text: Reindeer would hibernate until the snows have stopped if increased snowfall during the entire winter in southern areas occurs, after migrating south in the cold winter months to rely on less nutritious food such as lichen, following their summer grazing on young roots, fungi, grass, and other vegetation.

H2.text: Hunting for organisms such as small rodents is what reindeer have to do when increased snowfall during the entire winter in southern areas forces them to rely on the less nutritious food available, such as lichen, after migrating south from their summer grazing grounds of young roots, fungi, grass, and other vegetation.

H3.text: Move to other areas to compete for resources is what reindeer would have to do during increased snowfall throughout the winter in southern areas, after they have migrated south from the Siberian summer where they graze on young roots, fungi, grass, and other vegetation.

A4.text: On occasion, especially in the spring when they are nutritionally stressed, they will feed on small rodents (such as lemmings).

A5.text: In November 2016, it was reported that more than 81,000 reindeer in Russia had died as a result of climate change. Longer autumns, leading to increased amounts of freezing rain, created a few inches of ice over lichen, causing many reindeer to starve to death.
